snippet: Syria’s former prime minister, Riyad Farid Hijab, who defected to Jordan last week, said on Tuesday that the government of President Bashar al-Assad was collapsing.
abstract: Syria’s former prime minister, Riyad Farid Hijab, who defected to Jordan, says that the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad is crumbling internally under the pressure of relentless fighting against rebels, and from betrayals by loyalists who want only to flee.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and DALAL MAWAD
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Antakya, Turkey, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Syria’s former prime minister, Riyad Farid Hijab, who defected to Jordan last week, said on Tuesday that the government of President Bashar al-Assad was collapsing.
